title: James A Garfield National Historic Site: Fees & Passes
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Fees & Passes              Fees & Passes       Entrance Fees Entrance fees for James A. Garfield National Historic Site are $7/person. Youth 15 years and younger are free. Holders of the America the Beautiful - National Parks and Federal Recreational Lands Pass, including the Annual, Senior, Active Military, and Access passes are admitted free of charge along with three other adult guests.   Expanded Amenity Fees James A. Garfield National Historic Site conducts several "expanded amenity" tours each month. Fees for these special tours, including Behind the Scenes, Behind the Ropes, and the Civil War Tour, are $15/person. A 50% discount is given to individual pass holders. Visitors under 16 years of age are not permitted on the special amenity tours. Passes Visitors may obtain any of the America the Beautiful passes in the Visitor Center. Cost is $80 for the Annual Pass, $10 for the Senior Pass, and no charge for the Access and Active Military passes (documentation required for Senior, Access and Military passes). Please visit ww.nps.gov/fees_passes for detailed information on specific passes.  Onsite parking is free. Reservations Reservations are required for groups of 6 or more people for regular guided tours of the Garfield Home. Individual reservations are required for each Expanded Amenity program. Other programs may require reservations as well - please see individual listings. Reservations must be made by phone, 440-255-8722.
